text.tspan: In architectural practice the traditional way of collaboration is by
exchange of 2D drawings. The data is exchanged either electronically
or by sharing physical sheets with different collaborators working on
the project. Today with increasing complexity of the building forms,
3D models (physical or digital) are being widely used for better
comprehension of the structure. With the introduction and adoption of
advanced CAD tools like BIM (Building Informative Modeling), the data
exchange is done electronically by embedding the geometric and non
geometric data on a 3D model of the structure.
This project aims at designing a collaborative platform for AEC
(Architecture, Engineering and Construction) industry through mixed
reality by using HMDâ€™s (Head Mounted Display) for enhancing collaboration,
coordination and comprehension between different groups of collaborators.
